'Ornithine transcarbamylase deficiency' (OTCD), a common urea cycle disorder, is
a rare metabolic disorder, occurring in one out of every 80,000 births. OTCD is
a genetic disorder resulting in a mutated and ineffective form of the enzyme
ornithine transcarbamylase.
